thread.title: FTSE 100 movers: Morrison still on the slide; miners up on China hopes
thread.title_full: FTSE 100 movers: Morrison still on the slide; miners up on China hopes

title: FTSE 100 movers: Morrison still on the slide; miners up on China hopes
text:
33.04 +0.26 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - The FTSE 100 was slightly lower in the final trading session of the week as investors cast an eye on the US and whether the Fed will raise rates. The index of leading shares was down 0.49% to 6,128. WM Morrison continued to fall after reporting a slump in first-half pre-tax profits on Thursday and the sale of its convenience stores arm. 
Associated British Foods (LSE: ABF.L - news ) , owner of the Primark discount clothing chain, was down nearly 3%, after a warning earlier this week that falling sugar prices would hit profits. 
On the positive front, mining stocks topped the risers on hopes of a Chinese government stimulus with Rio Tinto (LSE: RIO.L - news ) , Anglo American (LSE: AAL.L - news ) , BHP Billiton (NYSE: BBL - news ) and Glencore (Xetra: A1JAGV - news ) leading the way. 
A report from state news agency Xinhua said Beijing is considering injecting more than 1 trillion yuan into the economy over the next three years. 
Rio was also given a boost after UBS (NYSEArca: FBGX - news ) upgraded the stock to 'buy' from 'neutral' with an unchanged price target of 2,850p.
